section: Except as agreed upon by mutual consent, the Joint Venturers shall not be required to make any capital contribution to the Joint Venture.
explanation: This statement could be interpreted in multiple ways. Does 'mutual consent' require a formal written agreement, or can it be implied through actions? The lack of clarity creates ambiguity.

section: It is agreed that either Joint Venturer shall, except as provided for below, have authority to execute instruments of any character relating to the affairs of the Joint Venture; provided, that without the written consent or approval of both of the Joint Venturers: (i) the Joint Venture shall incur no liability of any sort, nor any indebtedness for borrowed funds; (ii) no assets owned in the name of the Joint Venture be disposed of; and (iii) no commitment to purchase any item for the Joint Venture shall be made.
explanation: The phrase 'except as provided for below' creates ambiguity. The document doesn't specify explicitly any provision where one Joint Venturer can act alone. The lack of clarity on where this exception is defined makes this contradictory.

section: The Joint Venturers agree and declare that this association for the carrying on of a joint venture business operation does not, and is not intended to create a partnership, for either legal or United States income tax purposes, each Party recognizing that the other is willing and able to contribute capital, labor, and services for the operation of a successful joint venture business. Further, each Party elects under the authority of Section 761(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (the "Code"), as amended and all successor statutes, to be excluded from the application of all of the provisions of Subchapter K of Chapter 1 of the Subtitle A of the Code, and the Parties agree that the election out of Subchapter K of Chapter 1 of Subtitle A of the Code shall, if necessary, be manifested by their execution and filing of all appropriate documentation.
explanation: This section includes legal terms of the IRS code, but no filing documentation of the IRS code has been included, making this legally ambiguous and open to interpretation as to whether all the requirements have been met.
